funding.title: Project Funding
funding.body: Project funded under the 2023 Call for “KNOWLEDGE GENERATION PROJECTS” and for actions aimed at training predoctoral research staff associated with these projects, within the framework of the State Program to Promote Scientific and Technical Research and its Transfer, of the State Plan for Scientific, Technical and Innovation Research 2021–2023.

surveyA.title: Questionnaire for early detection of learning difficulties in reading, writing, and arithmetic for students starting 5-year-old Early Childhood Education (A)

generalBehavior.generalBehavior_1: In the notebook, leaves many eraser marks, the paper even tears or wrinkles from so much erasing
generalBehavior.generalBehavior_3: Behavior in class is good, but performance is low

speechAbility.speechAbility_1: Reacts slowly when having to answer questions orally
speechAbility.speechAbility_2: Expresses themselves orally with difficulty (for example, cannot find the words to express their ideas)

memoryAbility.memoryAbility_1: Loses personal belongings, such as notebooks, pencils, or pencil cases, or forgets to do or bring homework
memoryAbility.memoryAbility_2: Has difficulty following a series of several consecutive instructions
memoryAbility.memoryAbility_3: Needs other people to remind them several times about certain information, such as bringing materials from home to work in the classroom
memoryAbility.memoryAbility_4: Has difficulty memorizing the names of people or places
memoryAbility.memoryAbility_5: Has difficulty learning songs or children's poems, even simple ones
memoryAbility.memoryAbility_6: Has difficulty learning a schedule that is somewhat complex
memoryAbility.memoryAbility_7: Has difficulty remembering personal information, such as date of birth, phone number, address, etc.

attentionAbility.attentionAbility_2: Has difficulty concentrating on one thing for a long time (for example, when doing tasks, stops frequently, gets up to talk with other classmates)
attentionAbility.attentionAbility_3: Has difficulty repeating information just heard, such as phone numbers, people's names, or story content

sequenceAbility.sequenceAbility_1: Has difficulty assimilating time concepts (does not distinguish yesterday, today, and tomorrow)
sequenceAbility.sequenceAbility_2: Makes mistakes in order when having to memorize words or numbers in a sequence (for example, the order of the four seasons or phone numbers)
sequenceAbility.sequenceAbility_3: Needs a lot of time to learn to tell time

muscleCoordination.muscleCoordination_1: When coloring a drawing, goes outside the lines
muscleCoordination.muscleCoordination_2: Has difficulty when running and jumping (for example, falls often or gets injured)
muscleCoordination.muscleCoordination_3: When doing games with a lot of movement, for example, jumping rope, gets tired easily
muscleCoordination.muscleCoordination_4: Motor performance is low (for example, cannot perform the movements indicated by the teacher)
muscleCoordination.muscleCoordination_5: Has difficulty jumping rope, throwing, catching, or kicking the ball
muscleCoordination.muscleCoordination_6: In class cannot clap following simple rhythms
muscleCoordination.muscleCoordination_7: Has difficulty tying shoelaces and buttoning buttons more than children their age

spatialOrientation.spatialOrientation_1: Has difficulty distinguishing between up and down or between left and right
spatialOrientation.spatialOrientation_2: Has difficulty with orientation (for example, needs a lot of time to know how to get to different classrooms, staff room, or music room)

emotionsSocialAdaptation.emotionsSocialAdaptation_1: Has difficulty relating to other people (for example, often argues with siblings or classmates)
emotionsSocialAdaptation.emotionsSocialAdaptation_3: Gets discouraged or gives up on doing things easily
emotionsSocialAdaptation.emotionsSocialAdaptation_4: Has headaches, stomach aches, gets angry, or becomes nervous when feeling pressured

surveyA.validationError: Please answer all questions before proceeding to the next step or submitting the form.

surveyB.title: Questionnaire for early detection of learning difficulties in reading, writing, and arithmetic for students starting 1st grade of Primary Education (B)

reading.reading_1: Reading competence is worse than that of students of the same age
reading.reading_2: Has difficulty recognizing very frequent or familiar words
reading.reading_3: When reading aloud, makes mistakes with words
reading.reading_4: Attitude toward reading is worse than that of students of the same age
reading.reading_5: When reviewing their work, does not find the errors

orthography.orthography_1: Makes mistakes in dictation tasks, making errors in letters, words, or leaves it blank
orthography.orthography_2: Makes many errors when writing, such as skipping letters, not maintaining the same letter size, or not respecting the guidelines
orthography.orthography_3: Needs more time than other students to copy a text

writeExpression.writeExpression_1: Many words from their oral vocabulary, they do not know how to write
writeExpression.writeExpression_2: Written expression is worse than oral expression

generalBehavior.generalBehavior_1: In the notebook, leaves many eraser marks, the paper even tears or wrinkles from so much erasing
generalBehavior.generalBehavior_3: Behavior in class is good, but performance is low
generalBehavior.generalBehavior_4: Parents say the student studies a lot, but even so, their performance in class is low
generalBehavior.generalBehavior_5: Parents say the student has read many times the content they must write from memory, but the result of writing from memory is not good

mathAbility.mathAbility_1: For simple calculations (for example, 3+2), needs fingers or to make marks on paper
mathAbility.mathAbility_3: Has difficulties understanding the value of numbers they should know for their age

speechAbility.speechAbility_1: Reacts slowly when having to answer questions orally
speechAbility.speechAbility_2: Expresses themselves orally with difficulty (for example, cannot find the words to express their ideas)

memoryAbility.memoryAbility_1: Loses personal belongings, such as notebooks, pencils, or pencil cases, or forgets to do or bring homework
memoryAbility.memoryAbility_2: Has difficulty following a series of several consecutive instructions
memoryAbility.memoryAbility_3: Needs other people to remind them several times about certain information, such as bringing materials from home to work in the classroom
memoryAbility.memoryAbility_4: Has difficulty memorizing the names of people or places
memoryAbility.memoryAbility_5: Has difficulty learning songs or children's poems, even simple ones
memoryAbility.memoryAbility_6: Has difficulty learning a schedule that is somewhat complex
memoryAbility.memoryAbility_7: Has difficulty remembering personal information, such as date of birth, phone number, address, etc.

attentionAbility.attentionAbility_2: Has difficulty concentrating on one thing for a long time (for example, when doing tasks, stops frequently, gets up to talk with other classmates)
attentionAbility.attentionAbility_3: Has difficulty repeating information just heard, such as phone numbers, people's names, or story content

sequenceAbility.sequenceAbility_1: Changes the order of letters in words
sequenceAbility.sequenceAbility_2: Has difficulty writing dates correctly, following the order of day, month, year
sequenceAbility.sequenceAbility_3: Has difficulty assimilating time concepts (does not distinguish yesterday, today, and tomorrow)
sequenceAbility.sequenceAbility_4: Makes mistakes in order when having to memorize words or numbers in a sequence (for example, the order of the four seasons or phone numbers)
sequenceAbility.sequenceAbility_5: Needs a lot of time to learn to tell time

muscleCoordination.muscleCoordination_1: When coloring a drawing, goes outside the lines
muscleCoordination.muscleCoordination_2: Has difficulty when running and jumping (for example, falls often or gets injured)
muscleCoordination.muscleCoordination_3: When doing games with a lot of movement, for example, jumping rope, gets tired easily
muscleCoordination.muscleCoordination_4: Performance in Physical Education is low (for example, cannot perform the movements indicated by the teacher)
muscleCoordination.muscleCoordination_5: Has difficulty jumping rope, throwing, catching, or kicking the ball
muscleCoordination.muscleCoordination_6: In Music class has difficulty clapping following simple rhythms
muscleCoordination.muscleCoordination_7: Has difficulty tying shoelaces and buttoning buttons more than children their age

spatialOrientation.spatialOrientation_1: Has difficulty distinguishing between up and down or between left and right
spatialOrientation.spatialOrientation_2: Has difficulty with orientation (for example, needs a lot of time to know how to get to different classrooms, staff room, or music room)

emotionsSocialAdaptation.emotionsSocialAdaptation_2: Has difficulty relating to other people (for example, often argues with siblings or classmates)
emotionsSocialAdaptation.emotionsSocialAdaptation_4: Gets discouraged or gives up on doing things easily
emotionsSocialAdaptation.emotionsSocialAdaptation_5: Has headaches, stomach aches, gets angry, or becomes nervous when feeling pressured

aboutEPI.title: <italic>Hypertexto</italic> Strategy
aboutEPI.description: <italic>Hypertexto</italic> is a strategy that facilitates information management, promoting memory, comprehension, and expression. With <italic>Hypertexto</italic>, both the structure of content is addressed by organizing it into networks, and the use of signs and pictograms for more effective communication.

linearText.intro: A linear message can be represented in three different ways:

explanation.part1: Each message includes a title and two sentences that define and expand the content. The images presented below are examples of linear texts in different representations and network types, which are explained in the

images.iconic: Linear text of an I-I network in iconic representation
images.combined: Linear text of an I-II network in combined representation
images.symbolic: Linear text of an I-III network in symbolic representation

hypertexto.intro: Linear text is organized into a <italic>Hypertexto</italic> network or schema. This structure can be of three types:

organization.part1: To organize information, certain rules are followed, such as placing the title in a rectangle, the contents in bubbles, and the

images.i-i: <italic>Hypertexto</italic> of an I-I network in iconic representation
images.i-ii: <italic>Hypertexto</italic> of an I-II network in combined representation
images.i-iii: <italic>Hypertexto</italic> of an I-III network in symbolic representation

punctuation.intro: The program also focuses on expression, incorporating pauses when organizing information. In iconic and combined representations, images such as large stop for the period (.) and small stop for the comma (,) and "and" are used. In symbolic representation, punctuation marks are used: comma (,), "and", and period (.).

stop.title: Stop
stop.description: This image is used in iconic and combined representations to represent pauses in a sentence.

levels.intro: The recommended age for each exercise depends on the type of network and the representation of each exercise.

phases.intro: Completing an exercise in this application consists of three fundamental steps, organized into two distinct phases. This structured approach not only facilitates understanding of the process but also promotes the development of literacy skills in students. The phases and steps involved are detailed below:

first.title: First Phase
first.description: In this phase, the student faces the first two steps of the exercise, designed to strengthen their reading ability and information organization.

read.title: Read
read.description: The student must carefully read the linear text located at the top of the screen. This first step is crucial, as it promotes attention and reading comprehension. By interacting with the content, the student not only acquires information but also becomes familiar with the text structure, essential for their reading development.

order.title: Order
order.description: After reading, the student must place each element of the linear text in its corresponding place. This ordering exercise helps students connect ideas and concepts, thus developing critical skills in organizing and synthesizing information. By performing this task, students reinforce their ability to interpret and structure texts, fundamental skills in learning literacy.

second.title: Second Phase
second.description: In this phase, the final step of the exercise is carried out, where the student applies what was learned in the first phase.

express.title: Express
express.description: In this step, the <italic>Hypertexto</italic> network is presented at the top of the screen. Here, the student must execute the reverse process, placing elements in order in the linear text. This activity not only reinforces content comprehension but also promotes written expression by moving to symbolic representation. Through this exercise, the student has the opportunity to reorganize information and articulate their thoughts coherently, which is fundamental for developing effective and creative writing skills.

phases.conclusion: Through this structured and dynamic process, the application not only promotes literacy but also provides students with the necessary tools to develop a deep understanding of text and the ability to express themselves clearly and in an organized manner. This approach not only improves reading and writing skills but also encourages active and participatory learning.

phrasesActivity.intro1: Now we are going to order the elements to form the phrase. Look closely to the pictograms!
phrasesActivity.intro2: Remember that in this activity you have to order the elements to form the phrase.
